column4: When I try to install from the 6.10 live CD, rather than booting into gnome for the install (like it used to on my 6.06 lts disk), I just get a blank screen and nothing happens.
do you have it booting off of your CD-ROM?
Yeah, it brings up the list of ways to install, then when I select Install Ubuntu (and it would normally go into the GDM) the screen goes blank.
It does this is the "Safe Graphics" install mode too
I suggest either running the disk check option in that same menu, or burning a new cd

Assuming the disk check is okay, what are some other possibilities I can troubleshoot, or something I can check that would give you a better idea?  I realize "the screen goes blank" is pretty general lol
you said that your machine ran ubuntu before (juggling convos)
Well, I'm on Windows at the moment, but I've had Ubuntu 6.06 previously installed on this machine with no large issues.
alright, you have all necessary hardware then
honestly, the only thing I can think of is to burn a new cd
Yeah, it seems really odd. I've had Gentoo installed before as well with KDE and Gnome.
I'll try that first then
yeah, it doesn't take that long if you already have the .iso
Thanks for the help so far
no problem
I did a disk check; two things.  I was using a 6.06 CD and it had a checksum mismatch.
ah, so it was a faulty disk?
I'm guessing so.  I'm going to download Fiesty Fawn and try it
alright cool, I like Edgy only because it's a finish version
I'll upgrade when they're done with it
Yeah, I'll probably just use Edgy
